wikipedia_page.main: L. Radley "Rad" Flynn (June 14, 1902 – March 9, 1978) was an English singer and actor, best known for his performances in bass roles of the Savoy Operas with the D'Oyly Carte Opera Company from 1928 to 1951. He married D'Oyly Carte contralto Ella Halman in 1940.  In 1951, the Flynns toured in America and continued to play in Gilbert and Sullivan operas with Martyn Green.  They retired to England where they retired to Penrith and were involved with amateur operatic societies.  Flynn recorded five of his D'Oyly Carte roles.
